heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The closest lightning strike recorded happened on 13 May 2025 and was just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 14 September 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-easterly (136°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 97.0 degrees.    In the UK, a south-easterly wind can bring cold and damp weather (especially in the winter.)

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the outside temperature (up 3.1°C) and feels like temperature (up 2.7°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 6%) and rainfall (down 0.8 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 822 m), feels like temperature (up 3.5°C), outside temperature (up 1.8°C), and inside temperature (up 3.3°C) when compared to today.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 557m and a peak of 1248m, averaging 1318.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; cool or mild temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and calm and still conditions are expected. Chance of light rain, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and the light is absent. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
